title: Bill McSwain
added: During his time as US Attorney, McSwain's public office spent $75,138 to put his face on four billboards in Philadelphia, as well as Allentown and Lancaster. The billboards have the slogan "Gun crime = fed time, no parole, every time," with McSwain's face taking up a third of the space on each billboard. <ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.inquirer.com/politics/clout/us-attorney-bill-mcswain-philly-da-larry-krasner-fraternal-order-police-governor-tom-wolf-scott-wagner-20200724.html |title=U.S. Attorney Bill McSwain spent more than $75,000 to slap his name and face on billboards

title: Bill McSwain
deleted: The U.S. Attorney's office promoted a "Gun Crime = Fed Time" public awareness campaign, placing billboards in Philadelphia, Allentown and Lancaster to publicize the initiative.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2020-07-06|title=Fed Crime Gets Fed Time - Public Awareness Campaign|url=https://www.justice.gov/usao-edpa/fed-crime-gets-fed-time-public-awareness-campaign|access-date=2021-01-21|website=www.justice.gov|language=en}}</ref> This campaign received public criticism as taxpayer-funded self-promotion: the billboards each feature a large portrait of McSwain, and cost the city over $75,000. <ref>{{Cite web|date=2020-07-24|title=U.S. Attorney Bill McSwain spent more than $75,000 to slap his name and face on billboards|url=https://www.inquirer.com/politics/clout/us-attorney-bill-mcswain-philly-da-larry-krasner-fraternal-order-police-governor-tom-wolf-scott-wagner-20200724.html|access-date=2021-02-06}}</ref>
